batterySettings.discharge: Prevent discharge in fast mode and planned charging.
batterySettings.disclaimerText: These settings only affect solar mode. Charging behaviour is adjusted accordingly.

aux.description: Device that adjusts its consumption based on available surplus (like smart water heaters). evcc expects that this device reduces its power consumption if needed.

charger.ocppHelp: Copy this address into your chargers configuration.

circuits.description: Ensures, that the sum of all loadpoints connected to a circuit does not exceed the configured power and current limits. Circuits can be nested to build a hierarchy.
circuits.title: Load Management

control.description: Usually the default values are fine. Only change them if you know what you are doing.
control.descriptionInterval: Control loop update cycle in seconds. Defines how often evcc reads meter data, adjusts charging power and updates the UI. Short intervals (< 30s) can cause oscillations and unwanted behavior.
control.descriptionResidualPower: Shifts the operation point of the control loop. If you have a home battery it's recommended to set a value of 100 W. This way the battery will get slight priority over grid use.
control.title: Control behavior

eebus.description: Configuration that enables evcc to communicate with other EEBus devices.
eebus.title: EEBus

ext.description: Can be used for load management or statistics purposes.

general.customHelp: Create a user-defined device using evcc's plugin system.
general.title: Title

hems.description: Connect evcc to another home energy management system.
hems.title: HEMS

influx.description: Writes charging data and other metrics to InfluxDB. Use Grafana or other tools to visualize the data.
influx.descriptionToken: Check the InfluxDB documentation to learn how to create one. https://docs.influxdata.com/influxdb/v2/admin/
influx.title: InfluxDB

loadpoint.chargerPower11kwHelp: Will use a current range of 6 to 16 A.
loadpoint.chargerPower22kwHelp: Will use a current range of 6 to 32 A.
loadpoint.circuitHelp: Load management assignment to ensure power and current limits are not exceeded.
loadpoint.defaultModeHelp: Charging mode when connecting the vehicle.
loadpoint.defaultModeHelpKeep: Keeps the last selected charging mode.
loadpoint.electricalSubtitle: When in doubt, ask your electrician.
loadpoint.energyMeterHelp: Additional meter if the charger doesn't have an integrated one.
loadpoint.estimateLabel: Interpolate charge level between API updates
loadpoint.maxCurrentHelp: Must be greater than minimum current.
loadpoint.minCurrentHelp: Only go below 6 A if you know what you're doing.
loadpoint.phasesAutomaticHelp: Your charger supports automatic switching between 1- and 3-phase charging. In the main screen you can adjust phase behaviour while charging.
loadpoint.phasesHelp: Number of phases connected to the charger.
loadpoint.pollIntervalDanger: Regularly querying the vehicle may drain the vehicle battery. Some vehicle manufacturers may actively prevent charging in this case. Not recommended! Only use this if you're aware of the risks.
loadpoint.pollIntervalHelp: Time between vehicle API updates. Short intervals may drain the vehicle battery.
loadpoint.pollModeAlwaysHelp: Always request status updates in regular intervals.
loadpoint.pollModeChargingHelp: Only request vehicle status updates when charging.
loadpoint.pollModeConnectedHelp: Update vehicle status in regular intervals when connected.
loadpoint.priorityHelp: Higher priority charge points get preferred access to solar surplus.
loadpoint.solarBehaviorCustomHelp: Define your own enable and disable thresholds and delays.
loadpoint.solarBehaviorDefaultHelp: Only charge with solar surplus. Start after {enableDelay} of surplus. Stop when there is not enough surplus for {disableDelay}.
loadpoint.thresholdDisableHelpPositive: Stop charging, when more than {power} is used from the grid for {delay}.
loadpoint.thresholdDisableHelpZero: Stop when minimum charge power can't be satisfied for {delay}.
loadpoint.thresholdEnableHelpNegative: Start charging, when {surplus} surplus is available for {delay}.
loadpoint.thresholdEnableHelpZero: Start when minimum charge power surplus is available for {delay}.
loadpoint.vehicleHelpAutoDetection: Automatically selects the most plausible vehicle. Manual override is possible.
loadpoint.vehicleHelpDefault: Always assume this vehicle is charging here. Auto-detection disabled. Manual override is possible.

main.loadpointRequired: At least one charge point has to be configured.
main.name: Name
main.title: Configuration
main.yaml: Device from evcc.yaml are not editable.

messaging.description: Receive messages about your charging sessions.
messaging.title: Notifications

meter.titleChoice: What Do You Want To Add?

modbus.connectionHintSerial: The device is directly connected to evcc via a RS485 interface.
modbus.connectionHintTcpip: The device is addressable from evcc via LAN/Wifi.
modbus.protocolHintRtu: Connection through a RS485 to Ethernet adapter without protocol translation.
modbus.protocolHintTcp: Device has native LAN/Wifi support or is connected through a RS485 to Ethernet adapter with protocol translation.

modbusproxy.description: Allow multiple clients to access a single Modbus device.
modbusproxy.title: Modbus Proxy

mqtt.description: Connect to an MQTT broker to exchange data with other systems on your network.
mqtt.descriptionClientId: Author of the messages. If empty `evcc-[rand]` is used.
mqtt.title: MQTT

network.descriptionHost: Use .local suffix to enable mDNS. Relevant for discovery of the mobile app and some OCPP chargers.
network.descriptionPort: Port for the web interface and API. You'll need to update your browser URL if you change this.
network.descriptionSchema: Only affects how URLs are generated. Selecting HTTPS will not enable encryption.
network.title: Network

sponsor.description: The sponsoring model helps us to maintain the project and sustainably build new and exciting features. As a sponsor you get access to all charger implementations.
sponsor.descriptionToken: You get the token from {url}. We also offer a trial token for testing.
sponsor.error: The sponsor token is not valid.
sponsor.title: Sponsorship
sponsor.tokenRequired: You must configure a sponsor token before you can create this device.

system.restartRequiredDescription: Please restart to see the effect.

tariffs.description: Define your energy tariffs to calculate the costs of your charging sessions.
tariffs.title: Tariffs

title.description: Displayed on main screen and browser tab.
title.label: Title
title.title: Edit Title

vehicle.defaultModeHelp: Charging mode when connecting the vehicle.
vehicle.identifiersHelp: List of RFID strings to identify the vehicle. One entry per line. The current identifier can be found at the respective charge point on the overview page.
vehicle.maximumCurrentHelp: Must be greater than minimum current.
vehicle.maximumPhasesHelp: How many phases can this vehicle charge with? Used to calculate required minimum solar surplus and plan duration.
vehicle.minimumCurrentHelp: Only go below 6A if you know what you're doing.
vehicle.priorityHelp: Higher priority means this vehicle gets preferred access to solar surplus.

savings.configurePriceCo2: Learn how to configure price and CO₂ data.

sponsor.becomeSponsorExtended: Support us directly to get stickers.
sponsor.confettiPromise: You get stickers and digital confetti
sponsor.supportUs: Our mission is to make solar charging the norm. Help evcc by paying what it is worth to you.
sponsor.thanks: Thank you, {sponsor}! Your contribution helps develop evcc further.
sponsor.trial: You are in trial mode and can use all features. Please consider supporting the project.
sponsor.victron: You're using evcc on Victron Energy hardware and have access to all features.

telemetry.optIn: I want to contribute my data.

version.modalNoReleaseNotes: No release notes available. More info about the new version:
version.modalUpdateStarted: Starting the new version of evcc…

forecast.solarAdjust: Adjust solar forecast based on real production data{percent}.

help.issueDescription: Found a strange or wrong behavior?
help.primaryActions: Something does not work the way it supposed to do? These are good places to get help.

restart.description: Under normal circumstances restarting should not be necessary. Please consider filing a bug if you need to restart evcc on a regular basis.
restart.disclaimer: Note: evcc will terminate and rely on the operating system to restart the service.
restart.modalTitle: Are you sure you want to restart?

help.restartDescription: Tried turning it off and on again?
help.secondaryActions: Still not able to solve your problem? Here are some more heavy-handed options.

loginModal.iframeHint: Open evcc in a new tab.
loginModal.iframeIssue: Your password is correct, but your browser seems to have dropped the authentication cookie. This can happen if you run evcc in an iframe via HTTP.
loginModal.title: Authentication

chargingPlan.preconditionDescription: Charge {duration} before departure for battery preconditioning.
chargingPlan.title: Plan
chargingPlan.unsavedChanges: There are unsaved changes. Apply now?

batteryBoost.label: Battery Boost
batteryBoost.mode: Only available in solar and min+solar mode.
batteryBoost.once: Boost active for this charging session.

limitSoc.description: Charging limit that is used when this vehicle is connected.
limitSoc.label: Default limit

minSoc.description: The vehicle gets „fast” charged to {0} in solar mode. Then continues with solar surplus. Useful to ensure a minimum range even for darker days.
minSoc.label: Min. charge %

loadpointSettings.onlyForSocBasedCharging: These options are only available for vehicles with known charging level.
loadpointSettings.title: Settings {0}

targetCharge.costLimitIgnore: The configured {limit} will be ignored during this period.
targetCharge.descriptionEnergy: Until when should {targetEnergy} be loaded into the vehicle?
targetCharge.descriptionSoc: When should the vehicle be charged to {targetSoc}?
targetCharge.onlyInPvMode: Charging plan only works in solar mode.
targetCharge.targetIsAboveLimit: The configured charging limit of {limit} will be ignored during this period.
targetCharge.targetIsAboveVehicleLimit: Vehicle limit is below charging goal.
targetCharge.targetIsInThePast: Pick a time in the future, Marty.
targetCharge.targetIsTooFarInTheFuture: We will adjust the plan as soon as we know more about the future.
targetCharge.title: Target Time
targetCharge.vehicleCapacityRequired: The vehicle battery capacity is required to estimate the charging time.

vehicle.notReachable: Vehicle was not reachable. Try restarting evcc.

vehicleStatus.targetChargeActive: Charging plan active. Estimated finish in {duration}.
vehicleStatus.targetChargeWaitForVehicle: Charging plan ready. Waiting for vehicle…
vehicleStatus.welcome: Short initial charge to confirm connection.

offline.configurationError: Error during startup. Check your configuration and restart.
offline.restarting: Server will be back in a moment.

passwordModal.description: Set a password to protect the configuration settings. Using the main screen is still possible without login.

sessions.reallyDelete: Do you really want to delete this session?
sessions.title: Charging Sessions

sponsorToken.expires: You sponsor token expires {inXDays}. {getNewToken} and update it here.
sponsorToken.hint: Note: We will automate this in the future.

smartCost.batteryDescription: Charges the home battery with energy from the grid.
smartCost.loadpointDescription: Enables temporary fast-charging in solar mode.
smartCost.resetWarning: There is no dynamic grid price or CO₂-source configured. However, there is still a limit of {limit}. Clean up your configuration?

startupError.description: Please check your configuration file. If the error message does not help, check out the {0}.
startupError.fixAndRestart: Please fix the problem and restart the server.
startupError.hint: Note: It could also be you have a faulty device (inverter, meter, …). Check your network connections.
startupError.title: Startup Error
